scenarioDescription:
The DP Leo Exoplanetary System


Overview

DP Leo is a star with 0.69 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 997.01 light years away from the solar system.

DP Leo is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the DP Leo system


DP Leo b

DP Leo b was discovered by the Yunnan Astronomical Observatory observatory, in 2010-01, using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 8.19 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of DP Leo b is 1997.040 times the mass of Earth. The radius of DP Leo b is 12.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, DP Leo b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system DP Leo, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Yunnan Astronomical Observatory.
name: DP Leo - System With 1 Exoplanet
